articles.title: Post-Powell speech rally: Ethereum & Opendoor among top winners
articles.content:
US stocks (^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC) ended Friday's session higher, with bitcoin (BTC-USD) and ethereum (ETH-USD) also seeing significant gains. Crypto-related stocks, like Robinhood (HOOD), Coinbase (COIN), and Strategy (MSTR), and high volatility names like Opendoor (OPEN) saw price jumps.

Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal outlines what investors need to know about the market rally following Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's Jackson Hole remarks.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

Video Transcript

00:00:00 Speaker A

Stocks ripping higher to close out the week after Fed chair Jerome Powell open the door to a September rate cut at Jackson Hole. Powell saying, quote, the baseline outlook and the shifting balance of risks may warrant adjusting our policy stance. That fueled bets that the Fed could ease as soon as next month. Markets took that as a green light for risk. Meme darling, Open Door that jumped more than 30%, Ethereum spiked 13% outpacing a 4% gain in Bitcoin. And the enthusiasm spilled into some of those crypto linked names as well. Coinbase gained around 7%, Robin Hood up 4%, strategy up 6%. And this marks a sharp rebound after a pretty rough stretch for some of those high volatility plays. City strategist Scott Croner called the market reaction, quote, very positive, highlighting that a striking surge in small caps along with the equal weighted S&P 500 leading the headline index, it's really all incongruent a sign that the rally may be broadening beyond just Big Tech. Still Croner caution that there was some junkiness as unprofitable growth names also surge, but just really an overall risk on rally here amid Powell's dovish tilt. The question, of course now is whether this proves durable. Here's some of the reaction that we heard today following that speech.

00:02:16 Speaker B

I think he laid out the options in front of us by and not commit to anything. This is important. I know the markets think that he's committed, but I think at this point, there's a lot of uncertainty. I know that word's being used a lot, but the signals are mixed.

00:03:02 Speaker C

What Powell was trying to do today was to open the door to a rate cut in September. And what that does is that gives him a little bit insulation because if we get a really bad jobs report next month in early September, he can say, look, I opened the door to a move. Don't worry, we're on it. It's coming.

00:03:53 Speaker D

In a way, maybe he's auditioning for the role of Fed chair. You know, if you look at the text of the speech, he actually completely removed the phrase that has characterized his entire term as Fed share of data dependent. Uh that wasn't in the speech and he's talking more about the balance of risks, looking ahead, and it was actually kind of refreshing to hear that.

00:04:45 Speaker A

Now, there is going to be a fair amount of data that will be released prior to this September decision. As you just heard, there's still some uncertainty related to the inflation side of the Fed's dual mandate. So we'll have to wait and see, but right now, market's clearly interpreting this as a rate cut in September, Josh.

00:05:19 Josh

All right, Alex. Now, thank you.  Related Videos

06:22

Rate cut in Sept. is 'more likely than not': Fmr. Fed vice chair

Yahoo Finance Video • 17 minutes ago 02:37

Dow closes at a new record, surging more than 800 points

Yahoo Finance Video • 33 minutes ago 01:39

Why Opendoor stock is skyrocketing right now

Yahoo Finance Video • 37 minutes ago 02:11

Stablecoin adoption is driving demand for US Treasury bills

Yahoo Finance Video • 45 minutes ago

Kommentare anzeigen

articles.title: Stock market today: Dow jumps 800 points to record, S&P 500, Nasdaq soar as Powell's Jackson Hole finale fuels bets on September rate cut
articles.content:
US stocks soared on Friday as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell opened the door for a September rate cut during his highly anticipated speech at Jackson Hole.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) rose 800 points or 1.9% to close at a fresh record, while the S&P 500 (^GSPC) moved up about 1.5%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) climbed 1.9%. Friday's surge came on the heels of a downbeat week for markets, as tech stocks were beaten up by AI trade doubts.

SNP - Delayed Quote•USD

(^GSPC)

Follow  View Quote Details

6,466.91

+96.74

+(1.52%)

At close: 4:10:23 PM EDT  ^GSPC^DJI ^IXIC

Advanced Chart

Fed Chair Powell opened the possibility of the central bank lowering interest rates in September on Friday, saying in his speech that "the baseline outlook and the shifting balance of risks may warrant adjusting our policy stance."

With the speech touching both on the country's economic outlook and the Fed's new policy framework, Powell still noted that risks from inflation remain "tilted to the upside," saying that tariff-related inflation pressures "are now clearly visible."

His remarks shook up rate-cut bets, which had been waning after a weak monthly jobs report. Traders on Friday were pricing in about 91.5% odds of a September cut compared to 70% earlier in the morning and 85% a week ago.

Meanwhile, the 10-year (^TNX) and 30-year (^TYX) Treasury yields fell after Powell's remarks. The commentary also spurred a gain in bitcoin (BTC-USD) and other cryptocurrencies, with ethereum (ETH-USD) leading the crypto gains.

The White House watched Powell's speech closely too, as President Trump has continued to push the Fed and Powell to lower rates. Trump opened a new front in his public pressure campaign on central bank independence by calling for the resignation of Fed governor Lisa Cook for alleged mortgage fraud. On Friday, Trump said he'll "fire" Cook if she doesn't resign, though legally, presidents cannot easily dismiss Fed governors.

On the earnings front, Zoom (ZM) stock popped Friday after reporting an AI boost, and Ross Stores (ROST) jumped as shoppers sought discounts amid tariffs. Intuit (INTU) and Workday (WDAY), meanwhile, slid.

Shares of Intel (INTC) jumped 5% after President Trump said the government will take a 10% stake in the ailing chip giant, calling it a "great deal."LIVE26 updates

5 mins ago

Ines Ferré

Dow notches new record, S&P 500, Nasdaq jump as Fed's Powell signals September rate cut on the table

Stocks jumped with the Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) rising more than 800 point or 1.9% to close at a new all-time high record.

The S&P 500 (^GSPC) rallied 1.5%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) also gained 1.9%. The Dow and S&P 500 closed out the week with gains after a volatile week following a rotation away from tech stocks and into defensive sectors in anticipation of Powell's Jackson Hole speech on Friday.

Powell signaled that policy members were open to a September rate cut after disappointing recent labor data, despite signs of inflation due to ongoing tariff policy.

DJI - Delayed Quote•USD

(^DJI)

Follow  View Quote Details

45,631.74

+846.24

+(1.89%)

At close: 4:10:23 PM EDT  ^DJI^IXIC ^GSPC

Advanced Chart 36 mins ago

Ines Ferré

Trump says US enforcement of TikTok divestment law may 'extend a little bit longer'

Yahoo Finance's Alexis Keenan reports:

Read more here.  Today at 6:59 PM UTC

Grace O'Donnell

Apple, Google stocks climb on report the iPhone maker may use Gemini AI for Siri

Apple (AAPL) and Alphabet (GOOG) stocks climbed to session highs midday Friday after Bloomberg's Mark Gurman reported that Apple is considering using Google's Gemini to power a revamped version of the Siri voice assistant.

From Bloomberg:

Read more here. Today at 6:20 PM UTC

Ines Ferré

Intel jumps as Trump says US will take 10% stake in Intel

President Trump said his administration will take a 10% stake in ailing chip giant Intel (INTC) on Friday, calling it a "great deal."

Intel's stock price rose more than 5% in midday trading.

NasdaqGS - Delayed Quote•USD

(INTC)

Follow  View Quote Details

24.80

+1.30

+(5.53%)

At close: 4:00:01 PM EDT  Advanced Chart

On Tuesday Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told CNBC that the administration was exploring converting Intel's funding from the Biden-era CHIPS Act into equity aimed at stabilizing the company's US manufacturing business.

Intel is dealing with multiple issues across its businesses. Its manufacturing division is bleeding cash, just as its legacy computer chip segment forfeits market share to rivals Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and Qualcomm (QCOM) in the PC space. Intel is also woefully behind AMD and Nvidia (NVDA) in the AI race.

Read more here. Today at 6:00 PM UTC

Grace O'Donnell

Powell's Jackson Hole speech turns Fed's focus toward 'curious' labor market

Yahoo Finance's Myles Udland notes that Fed Chair Jerome Powell outlined the central bank's renewed focus on the labor market in the months ahead, which has big implications for interest rates this year and beyond:

Read more here. Today at 5:15 PM UTC

Ines Ferré

Opendoor rise more than 20% as even meme stocks rise after Fed Chair Powell's speech

Opendoor (OPEN) stock rose more than 20% on Friday as even the meme stocks gained after Jerome Powell's policy speech in Jackson Hole opened the door to rate cuts in September.

Lower interest rates would benefit Opendoor, which has seen meme-like volatility in recent weeks, as well as other iBuyers of homes. Today at 4:30 PM UTC

Grace O'Donnell

BJ's Wholesale Club stock drops 8% after sales miss expectations

Shares of BJ's Wholesale Club declined 8% on Friday after fuel prices weighed on the retailer's second quarter results.

On Friday, the company reported that overall comparable club sales decreased by 0.3% year over year, while comparable sales excluding gasoline increased by 2.3% annually.

Earnings per share of $1.14 topped Wall Street's estimates, but revenue of $5.38 billion disappointed expectations for $5.48 billion, according to S&P Global Market Intelligence

BJ's Wholesale also narrowed the range for its earnings outlook. For fiscal 2025, adjusted EPS is expected to range from $4.20 to $4.35 instead of the $4.10 to $4.30 previously forecast.

Read more: Live coverage of corporate earnings Today at 3:17 PM UTC

Laura Bratton

Trump says he'll fire Fed governor Lisa Cook if she doesn't resign

Just as Fed Chair Jerome Powell's speech in Jackson Hole fueled market optimism — following months of social media skewering from President Trump — Trump dialed up pressure on another member of the Federal Reserve's board of governors.

Yahoo Finance's Josh Schafer reports:

Read the full story here. Today at 3:12 PM UTC

Laura Bratton

Ethereum leads crypto gains following Powell speech

Ethereum led an upswing in cryptocurrencies as rate cut bets soared after Jerome Powell's policy speech in Jackson Hole opening the door to rate cuts in September.

Ethereum (ETH-USD) jumped 8.6%, while Bitcoin (BTC-USD) rose a modest 2.7%. Solana (SOL-USD) climbed roughly 4%, and XRP (XRP-USD) also jumped around 4%.

Crypto stocks were also on the move, with Strategy (MSTR) shares up 5.7% and Robinhood (HOOD) stock up 4.2%. Crypto exchange platform Coinbase (COIN) soared 6.6%, and stablecoin issuer Circle (CRCL) shot up 9.6%.

The gains helped pare or reverse losses in those stocks as tech stocks have been beaten down this week by doubts over the sustainability of the AI trade. MSTR and HOOD shares were still set for 2.5% and 3% weekly losses, respectively, and Circle was set for a 4% decline in that time frame. Today at 3:00 PM UTC

Grace O'Donnell

Chart: How Powell's speech changed rate cut expectations

As my colleague Laura Bratton noted below, investors rushed to price in near certainty of a September rate cut. Here's another way to look at how rate cut expectations changed in the wake of Fed Chair Powell's speech: Today at 2:46 PM UTC

Laura Bratton

Treasury yields fall as investors price in over 90% odds of September rate cut

Treasury yields fell Friday as investors priced in 91.5% odds of a September rate cut from the Federal Reserve following Fed Chair Jerome Powell's speech in Jackson Hole.

The 10-year yield (^TNX) fell about 5 basis points to around 4.27%, while the 30-year yield (^TYX) fell more than 3 basis points to 4.89%. Today at 2:32 PM UTC

Laura Bratton

Stocks surge, Dow touches intraday record as rate cut bets rise

Stocks jumped as September rate cut bets jumped Friday amid Fed Chair Jerome Powell's speech in Jackson Hole.

The Dow (^DJI) climbed 1.6% to hit an intraday high of just over 45,548. The S&P 500 (^GSPC) jumped 1.4% to near last week's record high for the index of 6,449.80. The Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) rose 1.5% to recover some of its declines as tech stocks have lost steam amid doubts over the AI trade.

DJI - Delayed Quote•USD

(^DJI)

Follow  View Quote Details

45,631.74

+846.24

+(1.89%)

At close: 4:10:23 PM EDT  ^DJI^GSPC ^IXIC

Advanced Chart

Powell in his speech in Jackson Hole on Friday opened the door to rate cuts in September, shaking up rate cut bets, which had been waning after a weak monthly jobs report. Traders are pricing in about 91.5% odds of a cut late Friday morning compared to 70% earlier in the day and 85% a week ago. Today at 2:21 PM UTC

Laura Bratton

Powell opens door to September rate cut, says economic outlook 'may warrant' change in Fed's stance

Yahoo Finance's Myles Udland and Jennifer Schonberger report:

Read more about Powell's speech here. Today at 2:03 PM UTC

Grace O'Donnell

Watch Fed Chair Powell's Jackson Hole speech live

Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell began speaking in Jackson Hole, Wyo., on Friday, where he is delivering what is expected to be his final speech at the annual gathering of central bankers, policymakers, and economists.

You can watch his remarks live below or on our livestream here:

Investors will examine Powell's remarks for clues about the state of the economy and the potential for interest rate cuts next month. The central bank is grappling with whether to hold interest rates steady in September to counter inflation or lower rates in light of weaker labor market data.

Pressure from the Trump administration to slash rates has also ramped up in recent months, with President Trump regularly calling on Powell to ease Fed policy.

Additionally, Powell is expected to describe changes to the central bank’s policy framework. The Fed is expected to drop its average inflation targeting policy, which sets an inflation rate goal for the Fed to achieve over the long run. It was put in place pre-pandemic, when inflation ran low and Fed officials wanted to avoid deflation.

Read more here about Powell's speech. Today at 1:59 PM UTC

Laura Bratton

Nvidia talking to Trump admin. about new China chip

Yahoo Finance's Dan Howley reports:

Nvidia shares fell nearly 1% Friday morning, on track for a nearly 4% weekly loss.

NasdaqGS - Delayed Quote•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

177.99

+3.01

+(1.72%)

At close: 4:00:00 PM EDT  Advanced Chart

Read the full story here. Today at 1:54 PM UTC

Laura Bratton

Stocks push higher at the open

US stocks rose at the open on Friday as investors awaited Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's highly anticipated speech in Jackson Hole at 10 a.m. ET.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) rose around 0.6%, while the S&P 500 (^GSPC) moved up about 0.3%, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) inched up nearly 0.1% — with those gains coming after another downbeat day for stocks Thursday.

The US benchmark indexes are still on track for a weekly loss after tech stocks got beaten up by AI trade doubts.

DJI - Delayed Quote•USD

(^DJI)

Follow  View Quote Details

45,631.74

+846.24

+(1.89%)

At close: 4:10:23 PM EDT  ^DJI^IXIC ^GSPC

Advanced Chart Today at 1:00 PM UTC

Grace O'Donnell

Nio stock rises after the Tesla rival unveils affordable SUV

Chinese electric vehicle maker Nio (NIO) revealed its new ES8 SUV on Thursday, sending US-listed shares of the Tesla (TSLA) rival 5% higher in premarket trading on Friday. The stock was the No. 1 trending ticker on Yahoo Finance on Friday morning.

The SUV is one of Nio's most affordable yet, with prices starting at 308,800 yuan (approximately $43,000) with a battery subscription plan. The plan allows customers to pay lower upfront costs for the vehicle and then upgrade batteries for a monthly fee.

Deliveries are scheduled to begin in late September. Today at 12:20 PM UTC

Grace O'Donnell

US sectors in spotlight ahead of Fed's Jackson Hole gathering

Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's speech in Jackson Hole, Wyo., today is expected to provide investors with a signal on whether an interest rate cut is coming next month, which could have wide-ranging implications for many parts of the economy.

Reuters broke down how some of the most rate-sensitive stocks have fared since the Fed kicked off its rate-cutting cycle in September 2024:

Read more here. Today at 11:51 AM UTC

Jenny McCall

Premarket trending tickers: Intuit, WorkDay and AMD

Here's a look at some of the top stocks trending in premarket trading:

Intuit Inc. (INTU) stock fell 6% before the bell on Friday after forecasting first-quarter revenue growth below analysts' estimates on Thursday.

NasdaqGS - Delayed Quote•USD

(INTU)

Follow  View Quote Details

662.66

-35.10

(-5.03%)

At close: 4:00:01 PM EDT  Advanced Chart

Workday's (WDAY) stock dropped on Friday before the bell after the software company raised its full-year subscription revenue forecast on Thursday, but a forecast in line with expectations for the current quarter pushed the human resources software provider’s shares down.

AMD (AMD) shares fell 1% in premarket trading following the news that Nvidia (NVDA) has told partners to halt work on H20 chip for China. Today at 11:50 AM UTC

Grace O'Donnell

Zoom stock jumps as Enterprise revenue accelerates

Shares of Zoom (ZM) jumped 5% in premarket trading on Friday after the communications software provider posted earnings that beat Wall Street estimates and raised its full-year outlook.

Zoom CEO Eric Yuan highlighted artificial intelligence as a driver of its strong quarter, with its AI agents underpinning profit growth.

The company posted earnings per share of $1.16, compared to Wall Street analyst estimates for $0.72, per S&P Global Market Intelligence. Revenue rose 5% to $1.2 billion, bolstered by 7% growth in Enterprise revenue. The company's monthly churn rate remained flat year over year at 2.9%.

Despite Friday's gain, the stock is still down 10% year to date, underperforming the S&P 500's (^GSPC) 8% gain.

Story Continues

articles.title: Robinhood kicks off football season with new prediction markets
articles.content:
This week on Yahoo Finance Sports Report, host Joe Pompliano takes a look at some of this week’s biggest headlines in the sports business world that you and your portfolio need to know. From the MLB’s broadcast deals with NBC (CMCSA), ESPN (DIS), and Netflix (NFLX), to the WNBA smashing attendance records, to the NFL’s latest partnership with Microsoft (MSFT), major money moves are reshaping the sports business playbook.

Plus, Robinhood (HOOD) vice president and general manager of futures and international JB Mackenzie stops by the show to discuss the company’s launch of its new pro and college football prediction markets.

Yahoo Finance Sports Report with Joe Pompliano, a vodcast brought to you by Yahoo Finance and Yahoo Sports, looks beyond the latest sports business headlines, analyzes all the need-to-know news - the teams, trades, and billion dollar deals - so you and your portfolio will win BIG.

Yahoo Finance Sports Report is developed and produced by Lauren Pokedoff.

Video Transcript

0:06 spk_0

Welcome to Yahoo Finance Sports Report, a unique look at the business of sports brought to you by Yahoo Finance and Yahoo Sports. I'm your host, Joe Pompeiano, and I'm here to coach you through the financial game. Today we've got JB McKenzie, the vice president and general manager of Futures and International at Robin Hood, joining the show to discuss the company's launch of its new pro and college call prediction market. Let's huddle up and get right into it.We are kicking off this week with PO's Playbook, where I take a look at some of the biggest headlines in sports that you and your portfolio need to know. First, Kendall Baker of Yahoo Sports reported earlier this week that new MOB media rights deals are close to being done, according to his trusted sources. Baker is hearing that Apple TV is out, while NBC is in talks for exclusive Friday night and Sunday Night Baseball.Games, as well as the wildcard round of the playoffs. The report also said that MLB is set to sell its MLB TV out of market subscription service to ESPN, and Netflix is in line to buy the rights of the home run derby. However, no deals have been finalized. Continuing on with more MLB news, Sports Business Journal reported on Tuesday that Music City Baseball, an organizationTo bring an MLB team to Nashville is prepared to welcome a new expansion team to the Tennessee City. Although the expansion process is still years away, MLB commissioner Rob Mannford has said before that he wants to decide on two expansive cities by his planned retirement in 2029. And according to Sports Business Journal, Nashville is considered to be a strong candidate for expansion when the time comes.Next up, Front Office Sports reported earlier this week that the WNBA has already broken its regular season attendance record with a little less than a month still left to play in the 2025 season. The W has already drawn over 2.4 million fans this season, breaking the previous attendance record of 2.36 million fans for the 2002 regular season. What's remarkable is that the Indiana Fever led the league with over 300,000 fans attending their 18 home games in 2025. Despite superstar Caitlin Clark.Having played in only 8 of those home matchups due to injury, and last up, the NFL and Microsoft announced a multi-year extension on Wednesday that will bring Microsoft co-pilot and the company's AI technologies to NFL club operations. As part of the extension, all 32 NFL teams will be equipped with custom Microsoft Surface tablets starting this season, enabling players and coaches to use co-pilot's AI technology to help analyze real-time data and make faster decisions on the sideline during games.And AI is not only disrupting the NFL, it's also changing the fan experience through broadcast, analytics, and cryptotechnology. NBA champion Tristan Thompson not only helped the Cleveland Cavaliers win their first title in 2016, but now he's the co-founder of an AI platform called Tracy AI. He spoke to financial freestyle host Ross Mack about how AI is changing the way fans and pros experience basketball.

2:46 spk_1

You said this year, correct me if I'm wrong, you said.When it comes to crypto, right, if you was to explain it to somebody, you say Michael Jordan is Bitcoin, Bron is Ethereum, Steph Curry is XRP, and KD is Solana. Break that down for me, bro.

3:03 spk_2

The reason why I'm in this space that I've really gravitate toward the space is because there's that bridge the gap moment, right? And I think even in, even in sports, I always like to correlate stuff to sports, right? There's a point in time in your career, you go from being, you know, the, the, the, the top three options to now you get to your later years and you become kind of the veteran voice and you become the bridge the gap between the coaches and the players, right? You know what.Sports, when you have young, the, the, the, the game is getting younger, right? So and the coaches are getting older. So you need that guy in the middle to bridge the gap between the two, and it's no different than in crypto, right? So for me, whenever I'm explaining stuff, I always like to use the knowledge that people can understand and grasp, right? At the end of the day, Bitcoin is like the OG, right? It's the first ever digital aspect. It's the one that has the biggest backing. It's the one that everyone knows.So I use Michael Jordan as an example, right? The guy that kind of revolutionized the NBA and take the NBA from being a $100 million dollar business to being a billion dollar business, right? So that's why I use him as, as Bitcoin. Bron used him as Ethereum because he's, you know, in my eyes I use Brown's to go to mys, but just out of paying respect for the older people, I said Browns with Ethereum, right? He's the next best thing.And then XRP I use a Steph Curry because it's, he's just as great and he has such a huge market cap and Americans love him, which Americans love XRP. So I just use it as my example and then obviously Solano KD where people can understand the tiers, right? So, I just alwaysLike when I'm educating people about 3 and crypto to be able to dump it into a scenario where they can grasp. So Tri,

4:32 spk_1

you already know, man. I'm gonna have to go ahead and get a little lightning around so you catch you off guard all the way, right? You need a bucket right now. You need a bucket. 10 seconds. Who should have the ball? Is it Kyrie or Bron?

4:43 spk_2

Kyle Kyrie, it's fast, right? You want me to ask quick? Kyrie, you can find those game set to step back.

4:50 spk_1

He was the savior that year. That that's a factory. Alright, Bitcoin and Ethereum.

4:54 spk_2

Bitcoin.Jordan or Bron, come on now. You already talk to me nice when you say this. Come on now.

5:02 spk_1

All right, I see behind you, you got Mohammad. So Mohamed of Floyd,

5:06 spk_2

come on, Ali, Ali, the

5:08 spk_1

greatest. And then the next one, obviously you're from Canada, so I need to know if this is a Canada team.UK rap

5:15 spk_2

or American rap? American rap. I know, I know the boy, I know Jersey was saying UK rap, but I, I just kind of agree with that he's American rap all the way to culture. You don't know

5:24 spk_1

that, that was, that was honestly egregious. I won't, I won't hold that against him though. Uh, and then lastly, AI for blockchain. You had your last dollar and you had to invest it in AI technology or blockchain, which one is it gonna be?

5:38 spk_2

You seewhat Mark Zuckerberg's paying for all these AI gurus, so I might go AI

5:43 spk_1

now that we

5:44 spk_2

talk.

5:44 spk_1

sports, right? I actually tip my hat to you because you're doing something remarkable, right? The intersection of sports, blockchain, and AI. You gotta talk to us about Tracy AI. Let the people know what Tracy AI is and more importantly, what you think the vision for it is.

6:01 spk_2

So, Tracy AI is basically an AI agent that I created, which is basically imagine a sports analyst or commentator on steroids. What I mean by that is that having all the high-level analytics that you cannot get from NBA.Dotcom and ESPN, which the analytics are coming from the professional teams like, you know, we have certain data and access to certain companies that only professional sports teams have access to, and I was able to be able to pull that data with my resources and be able to put into the AI agent. The reason why I did that is because I noticed that AI is taking over so many sectors, whether it's the music industry, which is obviously causing crazy controversy with AI, whether it's in art and digital and digital art, whether it's um.People trying to find jobs. If you look right now, Amazon is using AI agents to see who qualifies for jobs. Um, I'll give you another example. A law firm, a very prestigious law firm here in California has actually hired and created an AI agent to be basically, they're the bookkeeper and they're basically automated.Assistant like front desk, front desk girl, where they basically answer the call, have full conversations, take books, bookings, meetings, and really almost substituting that front desk girl and making it in the AI agent. So for me, it's like if it's covering so many sectors, how come it hasn't got into sports andFor me, it was like, OK, this is low hanging fruit, and this is an opportunity where I can be a visionary and a pioneer, because at the end of the day, from my upbringing being from Toronto and make it to the NBA, I had to grind for my success, and it's no different now. It's, I've always had this grind buildup mentality, so it just, it migrated so easily into the web 3 and, you know, if you look at Darryl Morey, he'sSaid he used uh AI just to curate his Sixers roster. Mind you, the, the record wasn't great, injuries and so on, but that just shows you that's the first domino effect and something great.

7:52 spk_1

That's epic, right? I, I think, you know, not only is it commentator, but it sounds as though you can also be able to leverage it, uh, for the, the sports gambling, uh, world at some point. They might not just have to pay the, the Jonta Porters of the world. They might be able to, you know, do it on the up and up.

8:10 spk_0

You can listen to the full financial freestyle interview with Tristan Thompson wherever you get your podcast. Now, we're going to take a quick break, but when we come back, with college football kicking off this weekend in the NFL less than 2 weeks away, a popular trading app is now letting you bet on the game just like the stock market. We'll explain more coming right up.Welcome back to Yahoo Finance Sports Report. I'm your host, Joe Pompeano. We've made it to the one on one, a conversation ready to break down news and sports with a key player in the industry. This week, we're speaking to JB McKenzie, the vice president and general manager of Futures International, Robin Hood. JB, thank you so much for joining the show.Today, I specifically want to talk about these prediction markets that you guys have launched more recently and more widely what's going on in the industry in a whole. So if you could just start with a simple explainer of sort of what sports prediction markets are for people who may not be familiar, and then why Robin Hood is interested in offering these trades.

9:12 spk_3

Well, first, Joe, thanks a lot for having me on, uh, long time listener, glad that I can finally participate. Um, but yeah, I mean, when we're looking at these prediction markets, they really have started to explode into the, the retail investment world, and what they are is basically a probability, right? You're looking at what is the probability of an event to occur.So, for example, the one that got the most news was about a year ago for the presidential election contracts, and that was who was gonna win uh the president? Was it going to be Vice President Harris or potentially former President Trump. And obviously we saw this tremendous interest that came into play, um, for people participating on those probabilities of that event coming true. What's happened since then is you've seen this evolution into other markets, whether it'sEconomic markets such as price volatility will, let's say the price of Bitcoin go above or below something. But more importantly, I think you've seen is moved into the sports world, and I think what you're seeing is that more and more people are interested in using these probabilities in their overall uh portfolios because it gives them a chance to trade in real time what's happening for something, let's say like pro football, college football, or other things like even like the US Open here in New York.

10:24 spk_0

Yeah, and, and when you think about uh the differences between production markets and traditional sports betting, how do you typically explain that to the average sports fan who may only be associated with sports betting in general?

10:36 spk_3

Well, there's a couple key differences. The first one is with sort of traditional sports betting, uh, platforms, they actually make the odds or make the markets, right? So they're actually putting them out there, and they actually differ between different platforms you're there, that you utilize. When you go to something like our prediction markets, first of all, it's buyers and sellers. There's people like you and me, Joe, that are coming in.And putting in um where we believe that market should be, and then what happens is it starts to evolve from there. It works like traditional markets like the uh equities, the options or futures markets where buyers and sellers come together to actually create what is the actual true price that they believe that market should be. The other area that it's different in is that it actually gives you the ability to exit.So, in traditional uh platforms, you can't exit or you have to do at a tremendous loss that goes to that specific platform. In these markets, because they are transparent and they're centralized, you can go in and out of that market at any time. So let's say you make a, you, you pick a a contract and it's moving in your favor, but you don't want to hold onto it any longer, you actually can close out of it without having a penalty, and vice versa if it goes below you. And then I think the final thing I would say that's really the difference between um these prediction markets andThe traditional sports marketplace is that you actually can trade them during the event itself. So, as the event is going on and the markets are moving, you actually can trade in and out of them, so that you can, you know, again, exit as the market's moving with what's happening in that market in real time. You don't have to wait for the event to end for you to find out whether or not you perhaps made or lost money.

12:11 spk_0

Yeah, and we were talking a little bit before this about just how some of the traditional sports betting players are potentially making moves toward the prediction markets as well and adding that as an offering within their wider offering in total. And for people who are listening that maybe aren't as familiar, there's a different uh regulation process for prediction markets for sports betting. If you're in sports betting, you obviously have to go state by state. Uh, some of these states have a specific number of licenses with high tax rates, whatever. It's a little bit quicker on the prediction market side depending on how you look at it, butThey're traditional players in sports betting, uh, I think objectively you could probably say have felt threatened by this. Uh, there is some level of, uh, lobbying and uh there's been lawsuits and other things like that. Some have been successful, some have not, but it's clearly moving in this direction where people are, uh, customers are telling companies that they're interested in this level of product. I'm sure you guys have seen that. But long term, where do you think this, this plays out? Where do we end up here between traditional sports betting versus prediction markets?

13:05 spk_3

Well, I think that I mean right now you're you're watching, as you said, sort of the beginning of it, as they come together and we're trying to decide what this, what the end result's gonna be.I think what is really telling to me is that uh you're watching those traditional uh betting platforms come into this prediction market space. So you have partnerships that have been announced CME and FanDuel yesterday announced a partnership. You've had DraftKings looking to acquire a uh what they call a DCM which is a a a a designated contract market which is known as sort of, uh, like the futures market and the swap marketplace. You're seeing them move.In there you're seeing ie markets acquiring. So people are moving into the space very, very quickly from that traditional space. I think what you're going to continue to see is that when you have federally regulated markets that are about done like it is on the futures and swaps world in our prediction markets, it makes it incredibly transparent to the end user. It's consistent pricing for them, no matter where they're located. Pricing is also very, very transparent as well. So I think end users are going to be the realWinner here because they're gonna be able to see financial rigor come into these markets that in many ways are bifurcated. Um, it's going to take time for it to play out, but clearly what's happening is our customers are incredibly interested in doing it. Um, they're participating at increasing rates quarter over quarter, and I think you're going to see that continue to evolve here or continue that trend to move forward, um, as more and more product comes to market and more platforms continue to offer these products.

14:30 spk_0

Yeah, and if we were to zoom out for a second, it sort of feels like to me that that Robin Hood, uh, if we just look at and and I'd love to get your insight and just kind of like the product roadmap and how you guys think about the business overall, right? Because it sort of feels like you guys are creating uh one stop shop for like everything financial someone needs to do for an entire new generation of people, right? There is saving, investing, spending, predicting. Is that sort of the plan, it's just to put like everything that someone could possibly want to do from a financial perspective within one app.

14:59 spk_3

Yeah, I think our goal, and I think it leads from our CEO VAD, which is we want to create the home for any financial instrument that you want to invest, that you want to trade, or you wanna hold in your portfolio, and make it very easy and simple for you to access it. And I think if you look at whom Robin has been over its career, it has been an innovative company that has totally focused itself on actually breaking down.Barriers and make it easier for people to participate in those markets. When you look at what we're doing here with the prediction markets, I think this is just another example. We're one of the first firms to come through the door. We think that there's a way for us to continue to work with our clients on how to build a better uh platform for them. We take their feedback and we listen to what they're talking about or what they want to trade. And I think you've seen that where we started off with election contracts, we moved into sports. We canContinue to add a variety of sports products, but we haven't stopped there. We've also looked at economic indicators, things such as what happens with inflation rates, what happens with the price movement of certain assets. We want to find ways where people can use this information as not only uh a sort of a data point for them to look at for their overall investments. Let's see what happens with what socially people are looking at in that marketplace and what their belief is. Couple that with someYou know, traditional, say, institutional data points, and then you can make a more, a more educated and more calculated investment as a trader. So I really think more than anything else, you're gonna see this turn into the opportunity for you to collect your information, make good decisions, then access markets that perhaps maybe you can't get at other traditional brokerage firms.

16:27 spk_0

Are you able to give us any numbers? Like, uh, uh, some of this is obviously public, right? You can go on Robin Hood, you look at the prediction markets, you could see the total volume, but just when we like zoom out for a second and look at the totality of what you guys have accomplished in the prediction market so far, are there any numbers or data points that stick out to you to show that this is really working and this is something that customers really want?

16:47 spk_3

Absolutely. I think, look, we've had over 750,000 people participate in these markets since we started offering them back in, uh, November of last year. We've traded over 2 billion contracts. And in the last quarter alone, we've seen over a billion contracts traded as well. So the fact of the matter is, is that the the our clients.are incredibly interested and intrigued with it. I think more than anything else, they're looking for additional products to come out the door, meaning they want to see us offer more and what we're trying to do is figure out what is that right product because what we do is we want to look at the overall marketplace and then decide what makes the most sense for us to offer. And so what we've seen is with football is a great example is we had a very strong client demand.We've built a product for them and now we're distributing it out to them. And so I think what you'll continue to see is the addition of product and more and more people coming through. I think we're at the beginning of a really transformational point for prediction markets and the participation for investors, uh, both retail, um, institutional, and beyond. I think this is a really exciting time to be in that prediction market space.

17:48 spk_0

So I would love to talk a little bit more about that actually, because one of the questions I had is how you actually come up with the markets that you're gonna be offering, right? I see some of these prediction markets, uh, they have the obvious stuff, right? Who's gonna win the Super Bowl, who's gonna win this game, whatever it might be, but then they have some other things that are like social media trends that maybe don't have as much volume, uh, that are just more fun.Gimmicky. Is there like a, I assume there's sort of a detailed process to go into finding out kind of which prediction markets you want to offer, but then is it, uh, is it at the point where it's like the more the merrier, it's not super expensive to want individual ones if we're going to do them anyway, so we just do more than we need? Like how do you think about that process of determining which ones actually go to market?

18:27 spk_3

Well that that that's a great question, Joe, and we actually use this as the sort of the same criteria, I'll tell you at this sort of high level. I can't give you all the secret sauce, but I can give you a little bit of the details of what we do.Um, is really what we do is we kind of look around the marketplace as a whole and we see what products or what, uh, what's trending and where do we have our our clients. Clients also write into us or or or comment into us on a regular basis of what they're interested in potentially trading. So we kind of have a wide net that we're looking at. Then what we do from there is we look a little bit and say, OK, what's the volume of the open interest because we want to make sure that a product that we provide out there has the appropriate liquidity for.Someone to participate in. And so as we look at those products, we start to then watch them and we track them, and then as they get closer and closer and we see a combination of client demand and um interest and liquidity, we'll then bring that product to market. We do that very similarly with other asset classes that I that I lead, such as the futures markets, but we do watch overall, and I think what's been interesting to your point is we've seen a trend of it continuing to develop. And look, we, we've done.You know, elections, we have done, uh, sports, um, we just went into the social uh marketplace for the first time offering the prediction on the Emmy, uh, Emmys, um, so we do see that this interest is really starting to expand, and we also see it happening much more in the economic, uh, world as well. I mean, look, you've got people out in in Jackson Hole talking about what's going to happen within.Interest rates and you see at the top of mind for people. So I really think what we try to do is figure out what is the breadth of product, bring it in there, but we also want to make sure it's in, it fits within our overall ecosystem. So it's an easy way for people to access it through the platform. We just don't want to pile a bunch of of contracts in there without people having the ability to easily access them so what what they're looking for, they can get to very quickly.

20:08 spk_0

Yeah, it feels like it's sort of like you want to give enough, but you don't want too much in distracting people, but JB, it's been awesome to see you guys enter a new market and just have so much success, uh, so quickly. So thank you so much for joining us today.

20:20 spk_3

I appreciate you having me on. I'm looking forward to coming back again real soon.

20:24 spk_0

The clock is winding down here, but we have just enough time for some final buzz. The US Open kicked off earlier this week in New York, and ahead of the last Grand Slam on the tennis calendar, Sportico released its 2025 highest paid tennis players list. Now, the top five highest paid tennis players on the list were filled with the sport's biggest names. World men's number one, Jannikinner topped the list at $52.3 million earned from prize.Money, endorsements, bonuses, and appearance fees. Five-time Grand Slam winner Carlos Alcaraz ranked second with $49 million. American women superstar Cocoa was 3rd with $35.2 million in annual earnings, and world women's number one, Irina Sabalenka came in fourth on the list with $25.4 million followed by 24-time Grand Slam winner Novak Djokovic, who had 24%.$4 million in earnings. All told, the top 10 highest paid tennis players made a collected $272 million in the past year, which is a 13% increase from Sportico's 2024 list. However, that figure heavily skewed in favor of off-court earnings, with the top 10 highest paid players earning 35% from prize money and 65% from endorsements, bonuses, and appearance fees.The sharp imbalance between on-court and off-court earnings highlights the global appeal tennis athletes have with their personal brands. The big two of Carlos Alcaraz and Yanak Sinner led the pack when it came to off-court income, with Alcarez earning $36 million in endorsements, including over $10 million a year from Nike, and Sinner making $25 million from brands like Nike, Lavaza, and racket Company Head, among others. But not far behind Cin was 2025 French Open winner Coco.Gaul, who made $23 million in endorsement money from deals with top brands like New Balance, L'Oreal, UPS, Rolex, and others. Plus 5 female players earned at least $10 million in sponsorship and endorsement income over the past year, including 4-time Grand Slam winner Naomi Osaka. And now the world's highest paid players on Sportico's list will look to add even more money to their 2025 earnings by winning the $5 million championship singles prize on the line at this year's US Open.We're all out of time, so it's officially game over for this week. Thank you so much to JB and for all of you for joining us. Please make sure to scan the QR code below to follow Yahoo Finance podcast for more videos and expert insights and catch us every Friday wherever you get your podcast. I'm your host, Joe Pompeano. See you next time.

22:47 spk_4

articles.title: Analyst boosts rallying crypto stock's target by 50%
articles.content:
Analysts at the brokerage firm Bernstein have raised the price target for Robinhood Markets (Nasdaq: HOOD) by more than 50%.

Bernstein analysts, led by Gautam Chhugani, raised the price target from $105 to $160 and shared an "Outperform" rating for the equity and crypto trading exchange.

Robinhood's crypto trading volume on the app growing 110% month-over-month (MoM) to reach $16.8 billion in July, as well as robust equities and options trading activity, are among the factors the analysts mentioned for their bullish outlook on the stock.

In addition, Robinhood's acquisition of Bitstamp to boost its institutional user base and the launch of tokenized stocks in Europe are also among the factors Bernstein analysts mentioned in their note.

“Robinhood’s diversified model offers crypto upside without the same volatility as pure-play exchanges.”

Bernstein expects Robinhood's diversified business model to help grow its earnings per share (EPS) by 53% per year on average through 2027.

Notably, Robinhood announced the launch of pro and college football prediction markets in partnership with Kalshi on Aug. 19.

The prediction markets are currently available across the U.S. through a Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC)-regulated exchange and accessible on Robinhood's derivatives accounts.

“Football is far and away the most popular sport in America,” said JB Mackenzie, VP & GM of Futures and International at Robinhood. “Adding pro and college football to our prediction markets hub is a no-brainer for us as we aim to make Robinhood a one-stop shop for all your investing and trading needs.”

The HOOD stock closed at $106.30 on Aug. 21, up 1.88% in a month.

This story was originally reported by TheStreet on Aug 22, 2025, where it first appeared in the MARKETS section. Add TheStreet as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

View Comments

articles.title: Crypto stocks, homebuilders, & bank names climb on rate-cut hopes
articles.content:
Market Catalysts anchor Julie Hyman and Senior Reporter Allie Canal examine some of Friday's trending tickers, including crypto stocks, homebuilder stocks, and the banking index (^BKX).

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

Video Transcript

00:00 Speaker A

Now time for some of today's trending tickers. We are watching crypto stocks, homebuilders, and the KBW Bank Index, three asset classes moving off the back of the Fed. First up, crypto stocks soaring amid the risk-on rally. This comes after a tough week for the asset, but Powell's comments sparking a rebound in digital assets and in the stocks that are associated with digital assets here. You know, we, Allie is still with me here. And Allie, you know, we've talked to a lot of investors who have said even though there's one line of thinking that crypto doesn't correlate to anything, there's certainly another line of thinking that there is an interest rate sensitivity there and that rate cutting would be good for those types of companies.

00:56 Speaker B

Yeah, and heading into this week, there had been a lot of commentary whether or not Bitcoin was reaching bubble territory and whether or not these crypto assets were rising a little bit too quickly. But we're seeing this risk-on rally today. We're seeing that reaction directly correlated in Bitcoin, which is the largest cryptocurrency. We are now up over 117,000 a coin. Before Powell's speech, we were closer to 112,000. So that just goes to show how quickly we've been rising here. Now over the past five days, we are still off around two tenths of a percent and we've really been struggling to get over $120,000 a coin. That has been really branded as this, uh, technical threshold by strategists, and we haven't really been able to hit that mark here. But you talked about those crypto adjacent companies. We're seeing names like Riot, Circle, Hive, Galaxy Digital surging today. Riot is up 9%. Circle, which is really benefited from the stablecoin boom, that's also approaching double digit gains. So all in all, just for crypto stocks for the speculative trade at large, we are seeing this rally across the board.

02:52 Speaker A

Yeah, and speaking of rate sensitivity, another group that we got to talk about, homebuilders. Homebuilder stocks are also getting a lift here because the sector has traditionally been the beneficiary of rate cuts. Today's gains follow this week's better than expected news on housing starts for July. You know, Allie, we've been talking to a lot of folks who are sort of desperate for mortgage rates to come down to unlock the housing market.

03:35 Speaker B

Yeah, the housing market just has been completely stuck. And you're right. Now that we have the expectation, at least on the part of markets, that we could be seeing rate cuts at a quicker pace, or at least in September, that is an encouraging sign when we think about borrowing costs for these, um, homeowners or would-be homeowners. You're seeing home builders across the board, uh, up. We have Lennar up 5% today. You have DR Horton also up around the same amount. Uh, KB Home is up, uh, 7% at this point. Toll Brothers up 6%. So across the board here, you're seeing those gains even in some of these home improvement companies, like Lowe's, Home Depot, we recently heard from them when it comes to earnings. They are up today. And, uh, they they did reference the fact that their business is so correlated with mortgage rates. And Home Depot said that as mortgage rates have ticked down a little bit from the highs that we saw earlier this year, that helped some of that activity. So this is only going to be a benefit for a lot of these companies that are tied so closely to the economy and really the purchasing behavior and patterns on the part of consumers.

05:35 Speaker A

And finally, let's talk banks to the KBW Bank Index up nearly 3% on pace to hit its first record since 2022. Small caps, regional banks getting a boost as well from these rate expectations.

06:03 Speaker B

Yeah, now I was just talking about small caps how they've been rallying, regional banks. I mean, it's pretty much the same story there. And they benefit from a few things when it comes to lower interest rates. One is that regional banks, they heavily rely on deposits for funding. And when rates are high, they often have to pay depositors more in order to keep that money in the bank. So a Fed rate cut eases some of that pressure. And similar to what we saw with homebuilders, it also is encouraging that lower rates means cheaper borrowing costs for those homeowners, for businesses, and that just means more activity for these banks at large. So the big banks doing well, but the regionals really a standout here too, Julie.

07:12 Speaker A

Yes, in focus. Thank you so much. You can scan the QR code below to track all of the trenders on our trending tickers page.  Related Videos

04:13

Market risks getting 'ahead' of itself on Powell's rate cut hint

Yahoo Finance Video • 28 minutes ago 05:04

How investors should adjust portfolios with rate cuts in mind

Yahoo Finance Video • 56 minutes ago 01:20

Canada to remove many retaliatory tariffs: Report

Yahoo Finance Video • 59 minutes ago 01:21

Bullard Says Fed Can Cut Rates by 100 Basis Points

Bloomberg • 1 hour ago

View Comments

company_overview.name: Robinhood Markets Inc
company_overview.description: Robinhood Markets, Inc. operates financial services platform in the United States. Its platform allows users to invest in stocks, exchange-traded funds (ETFs), American depository receipts, options, gold, and cryptocurrencies. The company offers fractional trading, recurring investments, fully-paid

claude_submission.prompt:
You are an expert quantitative options analyst specializing in systematic options screening and strategy evaluation. Your role is to analyze options opportunities using a data-driven approach that combines technical analysis, fundamental research, volatility assessment, and risk management principles.

Your analysis should be objective, systematic, and focused on the specific opportunity presented. Base all conclusions strictly on the provided data, and maintain consistency in your scoring methodology across different opportunities.
## SCORING FRAMEWORK (0-100 TOTAL POINTS)

**1. TREND & MOMENTUM ANALYSIS (35 points)**
   • Price Trend Strength (15 points):
     - Strong uptrend with momentum: 13-15 points
     - Moderate uptrend: 10-12 points  
     - Sideways/weak trend: 5-9 points
     - Downtrend: 0-4 points
   
   • Momentum Acceleration (10 points):
     - Strong accelerating momentum: 8-10 points
     - Steady momentum: 6-7 points
     - Weak/declining momentum: 3-5 points
     - Negative momentum: 0-2 points
   
   • Relative Strength (10 points):
     - Significantly outperforming market/sector: 8-10 points
     - Moderate outperformance: 6-7 points
     - In-line performance: 4-5 points
     - Underperforming: 0-3 points

**2. OPTIONS QUALITY ASSESSMENT (20 points)**
   • Liquidity and Spread Quality (10 points):
     - Tight spreads (<2%), high volume/OI: 8-10 points
     - Moderate spreads (2-4%), decent liquidity: 6-7 points
     - Wide spreads (4-6%), limited liquidity: 3-5 points
     - Very wide spreads (>6%), poor liquidity: 0-2 points
   
   • Greeks Profile Optimization (10 points):
     - Optimal delta/theta/vega profile for strategy: 8-10 points
     - Good Greeks alignment: 6-7 points
     - Acceptable Greeks: 4-5 points
     - Poor Greeks profile: 0-3 points

**3. IMPLIED VOLATILITY VALUE (15 points)**
   • IV Percentile Assessment (10 points):
     - IV in favorable range for strategy: 8-10 points
     - Moderately attractive IV: 6-7 points
     - Neutral IV conditions: 4-5 points
     - Unfavorable IV levels: 0-3 points
   
   • IV/HV Relationship (5 points):
     - Favorable IV vs HV for strategy: 4-5 points
     - Neutral IV/HV: 2-3 points
     - Unfavorable IV/HV: 0-1 points

**4. SQUEEZE/VOLATILITY DYNAMICS (10 points)**
   • Volatility Compression Assessment (5 points):
     - Strong squeeze with expansion potential: 4-5 points
     - Moderate compression: 3 points
     - Normal volatility: 2 points
     - High volatility: 0-1 points
   
   • Breakout Probability (5 points):
     - High probability directional move: 4-5 points
     - Moderate breakout potential: 2-3 points
     - Low breakout probability: 0-1 points

**5. FUNDAMENTAL HEALTH (10 points)**
   • Financial Strength (5 points):
     - Strong margins, cash flow, balance sheet: 4-5 points
     - Adequate financial health: 3 points
     - Weak but stable: 1-2 points
     - Poor financial condition: 0 points
   
   • Growth Trajectory (5 points):
     - Strong consistent growth: 4-5 points
     - Moderate growth: 2-3 points
     - Flat/declining: 0-1 points

**6. EVENT RISK & NEWS SENTIMENT (10 points)**
   • Earnings Safety (5 points):
     - No earnings for >30 days: 4-5 points
     - Earnings 15-30 days: 2-3 points
     - Earnings <15 days: 0-1 points
   
   • News Sentiment (5 points):
     - Positive news flow: 4-5 points
     - Neutral news: 2-3 points
     - Negative news: 0-1 points

**TOTAL POSSIBLE: 100 POINTS**

## REQUIRED RESPONSE FORMAT

You MUST respond with ONLY a valid JSON object in exactly this format:

```json
{
    "symbol": "TICKER",
    "rating": 85,
    "component_scores": {
        "trend_momentum": 28,
        "options_quality": 18,
        "iv_value": 12,
        "squeeze_volatility": 8,
        "fundamentals": 9,
        "event_news": 10
    },
    "confidence": "high",
    "thesis": "2-3 sentence overall investment thesis based on the data",
    "opportunities": [
        "Specific positive factor 1",
        "Specific positive factor 2",
        "Specific positive factor 3"
    ],
    "risks": [
        "Specific risk factor 1", 
        "Specific risk factor 2",
        "Specific risk factor 3"
    ],
    "option_contract": {
        "recommendation": "Specific actionable recommendation",
        "entry_timing": "Assessment of entry timing",
        "risk_management": "Key risk management considerations"
    },
    "red_flags": [
        "Critical warning if any (leave empty array if none)"
    ],
    "notes": "Any additional important context or caveats"
}
```

CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS:
• Respond with ONLY the JSON object - no additional text
• All component scores must sum to your overall rating
• Base ALL analysis strictly on the provided data
• Use specific data points to justify scores
• Confidence levels: "low", "medium", "high"
